results.title: And then there were four
results.creator_credit: Frank Strayer, Roland Reed and Roland Reed Productions
results.brief_description: Hollywood actor, James Stewart, narrates the story of five people leaving for work in the morning. None of these people are reckless drivers, but we know in advance that one of them will die on the road that day. When one fails to return at evening, we know he is the victim of a road accident. This film is a dramatic lesson in traffic law observance. An epilogue provides relevance to Australian road safety statistics for the time.

results.title: And the moon dances = Bulan terusuk ilalang
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, PT Genta Nusa Dwipantara and S E T Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Shot in Solo, director Garin Nugroho’s hometown, ‘And the Moon Dances’ is a rich visual and aural feast of feudal Javanese culture. Ilalang, a young music student, comes to Solo for an attachment at the local dance and culture school. This is where he meets Bulan, a girl who has just returned from America. However, the love between them remains unrequited as Ilalang is trying to deal with the trauma he suffered in childhood at the hands of his father. The paradox of the Javanese culture is the central theme of this film. To quote from director Nugroho, the Javanese culture ‘could be beautiful and soft at one time and violent the next’. Technically, this film surpasses its predecessors. The colours are rich and the sound of the Gamelan, omnipresent throughout the film, superbly showcased. This film received the FIPRESCI Award at the 1996 Berlin International Film Festival. Cast includes Ratna Paquita, Wiwiek Handawiyah, Ki Sutarman. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: And That's All. Part. 1
results.brief_description: A delightful, amusing puppet animation for children which involves two mischievous characters whose antics always lead to trouble. In this video, there are six separate episodes of fun and mischief.

results.title: And so they grow
results.creator_credit: Nat Campus and Campus Film Productions
results.brief_description: A real life story of a group of nine-year-old children. While the program does not make an issue of, or mention race, it shows children of many races growing up together and being enriched by the experience. In addition to the race relationship significance, the program also addresses the importance of good leadership in a play programme and the value of realistic play.

results.title: And how do you feel at the end of the week?
results.creator_credit: Kara Feldman, John Filmer-Mason, Filmedia (Australia) and Productivity Promotion Council of Australia
results.brief_description: Billy works in a factory and is dissatisfied with his job. His girlfriend works in a shop and has remedied the deficiencies in her work situation to make her job challenging and meaningful. Shows the relationship between job satisfaction and performance and how employees and management can communicate to create a more productive work environment.

results.title: Ancient Paestum : city of the Greeks and Romans
results.brief_description: In the ancient city of Paestum, in southern Italy, archaeologists have discovered remnants of a civilization founded by the Greeks in the 6th century B.C. and later dominated by the Romans. Shows the plan of the city and its buildings, many in the finest Doric tradition and in an excellent state of preservation. As well as the sculpture and ceramic work, artifacts and other relics of an ancient Greek and Roman culture.

results.title: Anatomy of an inflation
results.creator_credit: Philip S. Goodman, Charles N. Burnaford and Federal Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Inflation traditionally has resulted from excess demand pushing prices up when the economy is not operating at capacity. However, when the “production machine” is producing all that it can, increased demand cannot result in the production of more goods. Instead, the increased demand simply pushes prices up. As a result of viewing this film, students will be able to discuss what an inflation is, what its causes are, and how inflations can differ. They will also be able to understand the role of government with regard to business and the economy. Narrated by Edwin Newman. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Anatomy of a teenage marriage
results.brief_description: After five months of marriage, Dave and Vickie find that married life isn’t what they expected it to be. Suffering from boredom, frustration and problems of immaturity, they begin to realize that they must both make important changes to save their marriage. Second edition of “Marriage is a partnership”. No other credits available.

results.title: Anatomical models
results.brief_description: A study of the manufacture of anatomical models, and their use in demonstrating the position of various organs, bones and muscles in the body. Suitable for Upper Primary to Upper Secondary students. No other credits available.
